Package database

Class ElectricVehicleDB

java.lang.Object
database.ElectricVehicleDB
public class ElectricVehicleDB extends Object
Manages the vehicles in the ElecVehicle database and provides the public services to manage the database from the class ElectricVehicle.
Version:
2021-12-14
Author:
Lilas Guan
See Also:
SingletonDBConnection.getConnection(), ElectricVehicle

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public static int insert​(ElectricVehicle v) throws SQLException
      Adds a ElectricVehicle into the database of ElectricVehicleDB by using the SQL command Insert.
      Parameters:
      v - the ElectricVehicle to add in the database.
      Returns:
      1 if added successfully otherwise 0
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error or other errors related happens during the execution of the application.
      See Also:
      SQLException

    • update

      public static int update​(ElectricVehicle v) throws SQLException
      Modifies a ElectricVehicle in the database of ElectricVehicleDB by using the SQL command Update. Changes the made, the model and the date of manufacture of the ElectricVehicle in the database.
      Parameters:
      v - the ElectricVehicle to modify in the database.
      Returns:
      1 if modified successfully otherwise 0
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error or other errors related happens during the execution of the application.
      See Also:
      SQLException

    • delete

      public static int delete​(Long id) throws SQLException
      Removes a vehicle from the database by serial number using the SQL command Delete.
      Parameters:
      id - the serial number of the vehicle representing the primary key of the table in the database.
      Returns:
      1 if removed successfully otherwise 0
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error or other errors related happens during the execution of the application.
      See Also:
      SQLException

    • search

      public static ElectricVehicle search​(Long id) throws SQLException, NumberFormatException, RaiseException
      Searches a vehicle in the database by serial number using the SQL command Select.
      Parameters:
      id - the serial number of the vehicle representing the primary key of the table in the database.
      Returns:
      the ElectricVehicle found by serial number
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error or other errors related happens during the execution of the application.
      NumberFormatException - if the application has attempted to convert a string to one of the numeric types, but that the string does not have the appropriate format.
      RaiseException - if the argument doesn't respect the criteria that define the purpose of this variable.
      See Also:
      SQLException

    • select

      public static ArrayList<ElectricVehicle> select() throws SQLException, NumberFormatException, RaiseException
      Displays all vehicles in the database using the SQL command Select.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ElectricVehicle which represents the list of ElectricVehicle in the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error or other errors related happens during the execution of the application.
      NumberFormatException - if the application has attempted to convert a string to one of the numeric types, but that the string does not have the appropriate format.
      RaiseException - if the argument doesn't respect the criteria that define the purpose of this variable.
      See Also:
      NumberFormatException, RaiseException, ArrayList, SQLException

    • makeTrip

      public static int makeTrip​(ElectricVehicle v) throws SQLException
      Makes trip with a ElectricVehicle in the database of ElectricVehicleDB by using the SQL command Update. Changes the trip counter and the fuel consumed of the ElectricVehicle in the database.
      Parameters:
      v - the ElectricVehicle to make trip in the database.
      Returns:
      1 if the vehicle make trip successfully otherwise 0
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error or other errors related happens during the execution of the application.
      See Also:
      SQLException

    • sort

      public static ArrayList<ElectricVehicle> sort() throws SQLException, NumberFormatException, RaiseException
      Displays and sorts all vehicles in the database by mileage efficiency using the SQL command Select and Order By.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ElectricVehicle which represents the sorted list of ElectricVehicle in the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error or other errors related happens during the execution of the application.
      NumberFormatException - if the application has attempted to convert a string to one of the numeric types, but that the string does not have the appropriate format.
      RaiseException - if the argument doesn't respect the criteria that define the purpose of this variable.
      See Also:
      NumberFormatException, RaiseException, ArrayList, SQLException
